title: 36 Hours in Sacramento
description: This capital city has a gentle, small-town charm, with a strong theater tradition, delightful new restaurants and a vibrant art scene.

title: 36 Hours in Montevideo, Uruguay
description: The city is home to charming small museums, a lively old city and only a handful of tourists.

title: 36 Hours in Richmond, Va.
description: The city is strutting with confidence, moving beyond its Civil War legacy and emerging as a new player on the Southern art and culinary scene.

title: 36 Hours in Berlin
description: The Berlin Wall may have fallen 20 years ago next month, but in certain pockets of the German capital, the city is still divided — on whether the Iron Curtain was cool.

title: 36 Hours in Baltimore
description: Crab joints and sports bars now share the cobblestone streets with fancy cafes and tapas restaurants.

title: 36 Hours in Bermuda
description: Four hundred years ago, an English sailing vessel was shipwrecked on this mid-Atlantic archipelago, giving birth to an island nation that’s now in full-swing party mode.

title: 36 Hours in Cleveland
description: Local entrepreneurs and bohemian dreamers alike are sinking roots into this city by opening a wave of funky boutiques and sophisticated restaurants.

title: 36 Hours in Zurich
description: Handsome beaches, bohemian design and youthful chaos await outside the popular Old Town.

title: 36 Hours in Zagreb, Croatia
description: While the Croatian capital’s vibe is indeed more Vienna than, say, Belgrade, it can also be deliciously rough-and-tumble.

title: 36 Hours in Juneau, Alaska
description: Gold Rush-era buildings, quality regional theater and fresh seafood make for pleasant companions to this capital city’s stunning surroundings.

title: 36 Hours in Oslo
description: With tree-lined promenades and sidewalk cafes, the charms of a summer stroll in this pricey city will melt away the sticker shock.

title: 36 Hours in Warsaw
description: In the five years since Poland ascended to the European Union, a colorful injection of money and culture has given the city an unmistakable glow.

title: 36 Hours in Tulum, Mexico
description: A yoga aesthetic and stunning cuisine prevails on this beachfront town, located on the southern edge of Mexico’s Riviera Maya.

title: 36 Hours in Glasgow
description: Like the famously inscrutable dialect of its residents, this understatedly stylish city with its shopping districts and large green spaces is worth deciphering.

title: 36 Hours on Martha’s Vineyard
description: Despite its popularity among the presidential set, the island is still a laid-back place with a lot of mopeds, fish shacks and nice beaches.
